examples: the conference ended with a joint pledge to limit pollution

noun.description: A thing that is given as security for the fulfillment of a contract or the payment of a debt and is liable to forfeiture in the event of failure.
The drinking to a person's health; a toast.
A person who has promised to join a fraternity or sorority.

verb.description: Commit (a person or organization) by a solemn promise.
examples: the government pledged itself to deal with environmental problems

verb.description: Give as security on a loan.
examples: the creditor to whom the land is pledged

verb.description: Promise to join (a fraternity or sorority)
examples: Francie and I pledged the same sorority

origin: Middle English (denoting a person acting as surety for another): from Old French plege, from medieval Latin plebium, perhaps related to the Germanic base of plight.
